title: Lindsey Graham
deleted: In the ''[[National Journal]]''{{'}}s ideological rankings of Senators, Graham was named 41st most-conservative in 2003, 38th most-conservative in 2004, 43rd most-conservative in 2005, 33rd most-conservative in 2006, 24th most-conservative in 2007, 15th most-conservative in 2008, 26th most-conservative in 2009, 24th most-conservative in 2010, 42nd most-conservative in 2011, 33rd most-conservative in 2012 and 40th most-conservative in 2013.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nationaljournal.com/blogs/hotlineoncall/2013/02/facing-primary-threat-graham-rated-33rd-most-conservative-21 |title=Facing Primary Threat, Graham Rated 33rd Most Conservative |work=National Journal |date=February 21, 2013 |accessdate=October 8, 2014}}{{dead link|date=September 2020}}</ref>

title: Lindsey Graham
deleted: In May 2015, Graham said: "If I am President of the United States and you are thinking about joining [[al-Qaeda]] or [[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant|ISIS]], I am not going to call a judge. I am going to call a drone and we will kill you."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.lawfareblog.com/lindsey-grahams-iowa-drone-strike-out|title=Lindsey Graham's Iowa Drone Strike Out|first=Benjamin|last=Wittes|authorlink=Benjamin Wittes|work=[[Lawfare (blog)|Lawfare]]|date=May 18, 2015|accessdate=September 29, 2020}}

title: Lindsey Graham
deleted: In April 2017, Graham flew to Houston, Texas to raise money from "superstar plaintiffs lawyer [[W. Mark Lanier|Mark Lanier]]" and "[[tort reform]] foes." The fundraiser was timed just as House Republicans began to advanced tort reform legislation such as [[Class action|class action lawsuit]] and the [[Asbestos bankruptcy trusts|asbestos bankruptcy trust system]].<ref name=":1">{{Cite news|url=http://palmettobusinessdaily.com/stories/511104746-out-of-state-trial-lawyers-to-host-texas-fundraiser-for-graham|title=Out-of-state trial lawyers to host Texas fundraiser for Graham|last=|first=|date=April 14, 2017|work=Palmetto Business Daily|access-date=September 18, 2017|language=en}}</ref> (Graham used to be a [[Lawyer|trial lawyer]] before he entered public office.<ref name=":1" />) Because of the makeup of the number of Republicans and Democrats on the [[United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary|Senate Judiciary Committee]], if Graham voted against the proposals along with Democrats, he could effectively stop them in their tracks.<ref name=":1" />
